meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I misteuked the answer on the test.
meanings.sent2: She always misteuked the time for our meetings.
meanings.sent3: The robot misteuked the commands and started dancing instead of cleaning.
meanings.sent4: His plan misteuked the target completely, hitting the wrong building.
meanings.sent5: The chef misteuked the recipe, adding salt instead of sugar.

meanings.sent1: Making a misteuk can lead to consequences.
meanings.sent2: Her misteuk caused a lot of confusion in the project.
meanings.sent3: The misteuk in the play made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His misteuk was like a pebble causing ripples in a pond.
meanings.sent5: The misteuk was so obvious, everyone noticed it immediately.

meanings.sent1: He gave a misteuk answer during the interview.
meanings.sent2: The misteuk information led to a misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The misteuk map sent them in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent4: Her misteuk calculations resulted in a failed experiment.
meanings.sent5: The misteuk weather forecast ruined their picnic plans.
